title: With all the MMR boosting Bans here is a funny story for you
body:
So one day, I decided I was going to buy a League of Legends account online( yes I know it's against policies) but I did it anyways. 

Turns out the account I bought the guy was sending a keylogger while selling it to you and would just retake his account and re sell it. 

A very popular scam indeed but I didn't fret because I just had my bank look at my prestine credit card records and they just gave me a chargeback. Too bad for the scammer


I decided this wasn't enough punishment for the scammer who immediately blocked me off Skype thinking he was clever (silly little child I will always get my money) even though I warned him

I submitted a request with all the chat logs and even showed I played a game on the account and knew the old password and had it under
my email even at one point. I had all the necessary proof to ban the account that was being sold and resold and resold.

Paypal told me they banned that players account and gave me my money back after a 30 day long extensive search that found he was being flagged for scamming

- How very businesslike and professional of Paypal support.


Riot however did nothing. Nothing was done, after reading all the false MMR boosting claims I went and looked and found that the account I once bought and played on is still being played on today, and that guy is still scamming kids lol

I find this pretty funny and ironic that Riot is punishing players so harshly for wanting to be good at the game and escaping elo hell rightfully so

However if you are buying and selling accounts and you rat someone out they literally do nothing for you and that person is not just
cheating but is a legitimate THEIF that is condemn by every other company who I'm very grateful for my bank and Paypal support except Riot who is the only big name company that let the kid go to scam again.



*FOLLOW UP*

Magically within 5 hours of this post coming to life and getting upvotes(I really thought it would be downvoted to shit) and after 2 months of no punishment to that account. The account **no longer exists**. Now I know you guys wouldn't get to know what account it was anyways but this is _eerily weird_ as the account was active **TODAY **before I wrote this post

Also the submitted tickets was not even posted on this account or email so I'm not sure what happened, coincidence or not. I'm confused to say the least maybe he changed his account name after reading this? I don't know.

Right, but so is everyone on the enemy team. In order to believe in ELO hell, you have to believe that a person can consistently fail to win matches in which he is the best player. You also have to believe that results are not the most important indicator of skill. I find both of those stretch credulity beyond the breaking point.

The problem with ELO Hell logic is this:

1) A player stuck in ELO hell must be appreciably better than the other people around them.

2) The people around them do "unpredictable" (I read this as "dumb") things.

3) The player himself does not do these dumb things, because he's better than those other people.

4) If the player himself does not do dumb things, and he is by tragic mistake placed at an ELO where some players do dumb things, then he has four teammates who can do dumb things, and five opponents who can do dumb things. Basically, if he is randomly matched with someone who does dumb things, that person is more likely to be on the opposing team than on his own team.

ELO Hell is a psychological myth created by players seeking an explanation for the discrepancy between their perceived skill and their actual skill (for which the only reliable measure is results, pure and simple).

I think people who are actually lower Silver on a skill level might have huge problems when trying to climb out of low Bronze (placed there because they were new to the game, played on later). When I play with some friends of mine who are mostly Bronze I will just straight up dominate most of the games (I'm GoldV), no chance for my enemies, but most of the time I'll do that from an overall disadvantage since those friends of mine are just insanely bad, but tell me "Actually, I'm on a Gold/Platin skill level.". So sometimes, they'll just feed and feed and feed. In those games it's almost impossible to carry.
So I think Elo-Hell may exist, but only for player who's skill advantage just isn't big enough to carry most of their games.  So it'll be frustrating and taking more time than it should to climb up the ladder.

I've always thought of it something like this:

Low ranks tend to be a situation where ~40% of your games are unwinnable - no matter how close to your peak you play, you'll still lose - and ~40% of your games are effectively unlosable - no matter how poorly you play, you'll still win - and the last ~20% is where the difference is made.

The games you can't win and the games you can't lose negate each other, so all that really matters in terms of climbing are the ones where your performance makes all the difference. If you can win those more often than you lose them, you'll climb. If you can't, then you won't - *and shouldn't*.

I use to be really frustrated about being in bronze. I remember how irritated I was because people were just "not as good as me". I didn't understand why I was still bronze. I eventually changed my attitude and started focusing on my self. I almost instantly climbed from bronze to silver. I wasn't mechanically better. The thing that changed was my attitude. This is true for most people in bronze and silver. Mechanically bronze 5 - silver 3 aren't all that different. The main thing that separates the people in those tiers from people in gold is their attitude. As you go from gold to plat and diamond mechanics become more and more important. So what I would say to you is that elo hell is what you make it. 

I would also argue it is easier to argue that elo hell exists when you have never been in gold or higher.

Higher level players make smurfs all the time. All their smurfs are high tier a rather short time after playing ranked on those accounts. There is no elo hell, the majority of low tier league players are just experiencing the dunning Kruger effect. People aren't just high elo for no reason, they experienced silver too.
